command: bash -lc 'set -euo pipefail; ts=$(date -u +%FT%TZ); d=$(date -u +%F); dest=/opt/ti/closed/breach_monitor/$d; mkdir -p "$dest"; if scp -q -i /etc/ssh/keys/breachmonitor_ed25519 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=yes -o UserKnownHostsFile=/etc/ssh/known_hosts_breachmonitor -o IdentitiesOnly=yes client@sftp.breachmonitoring.co:/clients/acme_corp/alerts/today.json{,.sha256} "$dest"/ && (cd "$dest" && sha256sum -c today.json.sha256); then printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"breach-monitoring\",\"artifact\":\"%s/today.json\",\"status\":\"verified\"}\n" "$ts" "$dest" | tee -a /var/log/ti_fetch.json; else printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"breach-monitoring\",\"status\":\"error\"}\n" "$ts" >&2; fi'
explanation: Collects a private breach monitoring alert feed (JSON) delivered via a subscription SFTP service, validates checksum, and logs a JSON status, consistent with closed-source information gathering under T1597.
rationale_steps: Connect securely to the breach monitoring provider with SSH key auth and host key pinning.
Fetch the current alert JSON and checksum.
Validate integrity and store under date-based directory.
Record a JSON status for reliable, low-noise auditing.
